message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the hardness of materials and their ability to scratch or etch other surfaces. A windshield is made of glass, which is a relatively hard material. Option (D), jasper, is a type of mineral that is harder than glass and has the potential to etch the surface of a windshield. Options (A), (B), and (C) are all soft materials that would not be able to etch the surface of a windshield.

This question requires knowledge about the hardness of materials and the ability to scratch or etch surfaces. Option (D) is the correct answer because jasper is a mineral that has a hardness of 7 on the Mohs scale. It is hard enough to scratch the surface of a windshield. Options (A), (B), and (C) are all soft materials that would not be able to etch the surface of a windshield.

This question requires basic knowledge about the hardness of materials. Glass windshields are made of tempered glass, which is a very hard material. Only a material with a higher hardness than glass can etch its surface. Jasper, a semi-precious stone, is known for its hardness, making it capable of etching the surface of a windshield. Options (A) a sponge, (B) feathers, and (C) soft cloth are all much softer materials and would not be able to etch the windshield.
